title.narrative: Globaalivastuu arjessa - tietoa ja taitoa kestavan tulevaisuuden tekijoille
Global responsibility in everyday life - knows and hows for builders of sustainable future

description.narrative: Project themes are UN?s Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs 5 10 16 17) i.e. everyday actions to build sustainable future. Due to the interdependence of the 2030 Agenda goals selected goals are also linked to all other SDGs. Issues of peace and global inte rdependence and their relation to development and global justice are approached through concrete examples and dramatized stories. This enables Finnish students to relate to the reality of Global South from their own experiences.Project will encourage young people to be active global citizens. Alongside global development challenges students are told about positive change and encouraged to act on their own. Causal relations are discussed and skills of affection practiced in order to achieve SDGs. The project will employ experiential and action-based teaching methods in particular methods of participatory drama which evoke thoughts emotions and empathy. Teacher students? skills as global educators are strengthened through cooperation with their universities.Pr oject activities:- Providing teacher students with trainings to support global education with a view to offering skills and tools they can use in their global education work at schools- Providing school students in the Helsinki metropolitan area Turku Tamp ere and Swedish-speaking areas with Activity Programs on Peace and Development- The Activity Programs will be implemented using dramatized stories (process drama method) in which the project themes are explored through methods of drama. The plots of the d ramatized stories are placed in the fragile states (Zambia South Sudan Kenya Afganistan). The stories specifically address the following SDGs: 5 gender equality 10 reduced inequalities 16 peace and justice and 17 partnerships for the goals. Pedagogic conte nt addressing central themes of this project will be developed around existing dramatized storieslinking them to school curricula. Teaching material for teaching outside and remotely is produced- Organizing trainings for Activity Program Facilitators. Trai nings introduce the facilitators to the SDGs inclusive drama methods and the pedagogical content produced during the project
